articles.headline: Google Plus Will Be Shut Down After User Information Was Exposed
articles.snippet: Google did not notify authorities of the vulnerabilities in Google Plus, which exposed the data of up to 500,000 users.
articles.abstract: Google did not notify authorities of the vulnerabilities in Google Plus, which exposed the data of up to 500,000 users.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google said on Monday that it would shut down Google Plus, the company’s long-struggling answer to Facebook’s giant social network, after it discovered a security vulnerability that exposed the private data of up to 500,000 users.

articles.headline: Migrant Children in Search of Justice: A 2-Year-Old’s Day in Immigration Court
articles.snippet: Immigration courts are full of children like Fernanda. A relative brought her to the United States from Honduras, and now her grandparents are trying to get her back.
articles.abstract: Immigration courts are full of children like Fernanda. A relative brought her to the United States from Honduras, and now her grandparents are trying to get her back.
articles.lead_paragraph: The youngest child to come before the bench in federal immigration courtroom No. 14 was so small she had to be lifted into the chair. Even the judge in her black robes breathed a soft “aww” as her latest case perched on the brown leather.
articles.byline: By Vivian Yee and Miriam Jordan

articles.headline: Rick Gates Sought Online Manipulation Plans From Israeli Intelligence Firm for Trump Campaign
articles.snippet: The company pitched plans for fake avatars that would try to persuade Republican delegates to back the Trump campaign over that of Senator Ted Cruz and to gather intelligence on Hillary Clinton.
articles.abstract: The company pitched plans for fake avatars that would try to persuade Republican delegates to back the Trump campaign over that of Senator Ted Cruz and to gather intelligence on Hillary Clinton.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A top Trump campaign official requested proposals in 2016 from an Israeli company to create fake online identities, to use social media manipulation and to gather intelligence to help defeat Republican primary race opponents and Hillary Clinton, according to interviews and copies of the proposals.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti, Ronen Bergman, David D. Kirkpatrick and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: When Designer Steel From Lapland Makes Sense, DespiteTariffs
articles.snippet: The Finnish steel manufacturer Outokumpu has access to mineral deposits that give it a clear advantage over U.S. makers. But Trump’s tariffs are raising prices for American customers.
articles.abstract: The Finnish steel manufacturer Outokumpu has access to mineral deposits that give it a clear advantage over U.S. makers. But Trump’s tariffs are raising prices for American customers.
articles.lead_paragraph: TORNIO, Finland — You must have a very good reason to toil in iron-melting heat an hour’s drive south of the Arctic Circle.

articles.headline: ‘Our Hands Can Reach You’: Khashoggi Case Shakes Saudi Dissidents Abroad
articles.snippet: Saudi Arabia has increasingly reached across borders to keep dissidents in line. But if the critic Jamal Khashoggi has been killed, it would be a startling escalation.
articles.abstract: Saudi Arabia has increasingly reached across borders to keep dissidents in line. But if the critic Jamal Khashoggi has been killed, it would be a startling escalation.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT — A Saudi women’s rights activist was driving in the United Arab Emirates when she was pulled over by security officers, thrown on a plane to Saudi Arabia and jailed.

articles.headline: Dire Climate Warning Lands With a Thud on Trump’s Desk
articles.snippet: A day after the U.N. issued a call to arms for the world to confront climate change, President Trump, who has mocked the science around it, did not broach the topic, even in vulnerable Florida.
articles.abstract: A day after the U.N. issued a call to arms for the world to confront climate change, President Trump, who has mocked the science around it, did not broach the topic, even in vulnerable Florida.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A day after the United Nations issued its most urgent call to arms yet for the world to confront the threat of climate change, President Trump boarded Air Force One for Florida — a state that lies directly in the path of this coming calamity — and said nothing about it.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Coral Davenport

articles.headline: Why Some Amazon Workers Are Fuming About Their Raise
articles.snippet: Last week the company was praised for increasing what it paid its warehouse workers. Now the company is explaining what that means for bonuses and stock grants.
articles.abstract: Last week the company was praised for increasing what it paid its warehouse workers. Now the company is explaining what that means for bonuses and stock grants.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Last week, Dave Clark, Amazon’s senior vice president in charge of operations, stood on a ladder in a warehouse near Los Angeles and announced to employees that Amazon was raising pay for its vast blue-collar work force.

articles.headline: The Unknowable Fallout of China’s Trade War Nuclear Option
articles.snippet: China holds more than a trillion dollars in United States debt, and an escalating trade war could tempt it to wield that debt in a way that has long been unthinkable.
articles.abstract: China holds more than a trillion dollars in United States debt, and an escalating trade war could tempt it to wield that debt in a way that has long been unthinkable.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is often called the nuclear option.

articles.headline: Turkish Officials Say Khashoggi Was Killed on Order of Saudi Leadership
articles.snippet: Security officials have concluded that the Saudi dissident was killed within two hours of his arrival at the Saudi Consulate in Istanbul, and his body dismembered.
articles.abstract: Security officials have concluded that the Saudi dissident was killed within two hours of his arrival at the Saudi Consulate in Istanbul, and his body dismembered.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey — Top Turkish security officials have concluded that the Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi was assassinated in the Saudi Consulate in Istanbul on orders from the highest levels of the royal court, a senior official said Tuesday.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick and Carlotta Gall

articles.headline: Nikki Haley to Resign as Trump’s Ambassador to the U.N.
articles.snippet: Ms. Haley, one of the few high-profile women in the Trump administration, said she would leave at the end of the year because she wanted a break after two years in a rigorous job.
articles.abstract: Ms. Haley, one of the few high-profile women in the Trump administration, said she would leave at the end of the year because she wanted a break after two years in a rigorous job.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s ambassador to the United Nations, Nikki R. Haley, said on Tuesday that she would resign at the end of the year, marking the departure of one of the few high-profile women in the Trump administration.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Mark Landler and Edward Wong

articles.headline: Trump Claims Trade Victories but Businesses Struggle Under His Approach
articles.snippet: Farmers, automakers and other businesses are feeling pain from the president’s steel and aluminum tariffs, which remain in place despite a revised North American Free Trade Agreement.
articles.abstract: Farmers, automakers and other businesses are feeling pain from the president’s steel and aluminum tariffs, which remain in place despite a revised North American Free Trade Agreement.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has spent the past week praising his new trade agreement with Canada and Mexico as a win for farmers, saying the pact will send cash pouring into the United States and enrich America’s agriculture and industrial workers.
